Item ID11840

Dragon boots are boots made of Orikalkum metal. Like most other dragon items they cannot be made using the Smithing skill. The boots require a Defence level of 60 to wear.

Dragon boots are commonly used due to their strength bonus and relatively low cost. Thus, they are popular with those training the Slayer skill and player killing.

They are among the strongest boots defensively. They are only surpassed by the upgraded version primordial boots as well as Bandos boots and their respective upgrade guardian boots. The Granite boots have a +8 ranged defence and otherwise only slightly worse other bonuses.

Players can attach a dragon boots ornament kit, obtained from hard clue scrolls, to create gold-trimmed dragon boots (g). This is only cosmetic, and does not affect the boots' stat bonuses. It can be dismantled, returning the boots and ornament kit.

With level 60 in Runecraft and Magic, dragon boots can be combined with a primordial crystal to create a pair of primordial boots, which have increased stats and remain tradeable. The process cannot be reversed.

[[File:Dragon boots detail.png|left|150px|A detailed image of Dragon boots.]]
'''Dragon boots''' are boots made of [[Orikalkum]] metal. Like most other dragon items they cannot be made using the [[Smithing]] skill. The boots require a [[Defence]] level of 60 to wear.

Dragon boots are commonly used due to their strength bonus and relatively low cost. Thus, they are popular with those training the [[Slayer]] skill and [[player killing]].

They are among the strongest boots defensively. They are only surpassed by the upgraded version [[primordial boots]] as well as [[Bandos boots]] and their respective upgrade [[guardian boots]]. The [[Granite boots]] have a +8 ranged defence and otherwise only slightly worse other bonuses.

Players can attach a [[dragon boots ornament kit]], obtained from [[Clue scroll (hard)|hard clue scrolls]], to create gold-trimmed [[dragon boots (g)]]. This is only cosmetic, and does not affect the boots' stat bonuses. It can be dismantled, returning the boots and ornament kit.

With level 60 in [[Runecraft]] and [[Magic]], dragon boots can be combined with a [[primordial crystal]] to create a pair of [[primordial boots]], which have increased stats and remain tradeable. The process '''cannot''' be reversed.
